revised_title: On the Identity of Columbium and Tantalum: A Comparative Analysis
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, investigates the identity of columbium and tantalum by analyzing their properties and comparing them to Swedish and American mineral samples. He finds that both minerals contain the same metal, despite differences in their specific gravities. The white oxide obtained from each mineral has the same properties, such as solubility in potash and insolubility in various acids.
